definitions.text: fail to keep or to maintain; cease to have, either physically or in an abstract sense
examples: She lost her purse when she left it unattended on her seat
We lost the battle but we won the war

definitions.text: suffer the loss of a person through death or removal
examples: She lost her husband in the war
The couple that wanted to adopt the child lost her when the biological parents claimed her

definitions.text: place (something) where one cannot find it again
miss from one's possessions; lose sight of
allow to go out of sight
examples: The detective lost the man he was shadowing after he had to stop at a red light

definitions.text: fail to make money in a business; make a loss or fail to profit
examples: I lost thousands of dollars on that bad investment!
The company turned a loss after the first year
I lost the opportunity to spend a year abroad

definitions.text: fail to perceive or to catch with the senses or the mind
examples: We lost part of what he said
This author really suffers in translation
